Package model.project

Class ProjectManager

java.lang.Object
model.Manager
model.project.ProjectManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyChangeObservable
public class ProjectManager
extends Manager
ProjectManager is responsible for executing all the commands needed for the application that are related to projects.

Remark that it is implemented with the singleton pattern, so only one instance of it exists.

Author:
Bori Fazakas

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ProjectManager getInstance()

    • createProject

      public void createProject​(java.lang.String projectName, int teamId, java.lang.String assigneeName, java.time.LocalDate deadline, java.lang.String description, Project.Importance importance) throws NoSignedInUserException, java.sql.SQLException, InexistentUserException, InexistentTeamException, DuplicateProjectNameException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, EmptyFieldsException, InvalidDeadlineException
      Creates a new project with the specified data and saves it in the database. The supervisor of the project will be automatically the current user. There should not be another project with the same title/name in the team.
      Parameters:
      projectName - is the name of the project to be saved.
      teamId - is the id of the team to which the new project belongs.
      assigneeName - is the name of the user to whom this project is assigned.
      deadline - is the deadline of the project to be saved.
      description - is the description of the project to be saved.
      Throws:
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is no one signed in.
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentUserException - if the user with assigneeName does not exist.
      InexistentTeamException - if the team with teamId does not exist.
      DuplicateProjectNameException - if there is already a project with the same name in the same team. This is not allowed.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      InvalidDeadlineException - if the selected deadline is outdated.
      EmptyFieldsException

    • updateProject

      public void updateProject​(int projectId, java.lang.String newProjectTitle, java.lang.String newAssigneeName, java.lang.String newSupervisorName, java.time.LocalDate newDeadline, java.lang.String newDescription, Project.Importance importance) throws NoSignedInUserException, java.sql.SQLException, InexistentProjectException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, UnauthorisedOperationException, InexistentUserException, DuplicateProjectNameException, UnregisteredMemberRoleException, InvalidDeadlineException
      Updates the data of the project with id projectId with the specified data, provided that all the teams and users mentions exist, and the current user is the supervisor of the project. For others, these settings are not accessible.
      Parameters:
      projectId - is the id of the project to be updated.
      newProjectTitle - is the title to set.
      newAssigneeName - is the name of the new assignee.
      newSupervisorName - is the nam of the new supervisor.
      newDeadline - is the new deadline of the project.
      newDescription - is the new description of the project.
      Throws:
      NoSignedInUserException - is there is noone signed in.
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentUserException - if the user with assigneeName does not exist.
      InexistentProjectException - if the project to update does not exist.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not the manager of the team.
      InexistentUserException - if the user with assigneeName does not exist.
      DuplicateProjectNameException - if there is already another project in the team with the desired name.
      UnregisteredMemberRoleException - if the assignee or the supervisor to be set is not the member of the team.
      InvalidDeadlineException - if the selected deadline is outdated.

    • deleteProject

      public void deleteProject​(int projectId) throws InexistentProjectException, java.sql.SQLException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, UnauthorisedOperationException
      Deletes the project with id projectId with all of its data (comments), but only if the current user is the supervisor of the project.
      Parameters:
      projectId - is the id of the project to delete.
      Throws:
      InexistentProjectException - if the project to delete is not found.
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is noone signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not the supervisor of the project.

    • deleteAllProjectsOfTeam

      public void deleteAllProjectsOfTeam​(int teamId) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, InexistentUserException
      Deletes all the projects of a given team, safely, after first deleting all of its their comments.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team whose projects are deleted.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      InexistentUserException - should never occur.

    • setProjectInProgress

      public void setProjectInProgress​(int projectId) throws InexistentProjectException, java.sql.SQLException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, IllegalProjectStatusChangeException
      Sets a project's status from TO_DO to IN_PROGRESS.
      Parameters:
      projectId - is the id of the project to update.
      Throws:
      InexistentProjectException - if the Project with projectId does not exist.
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      IllegalProjectStatusChangeException - if the current status of the project is not TO_DO.

    • setProjectAsToDo

      public void setProjectAsToDo​(int projectId) throws InexistentProjectException, java.sql.SQLException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, UnauthorisedOperationException, IllegalProjectStatusChangeException
      Sets a project's status from IN_PROGRESS to TO_DO, but only if the current user is the asignee.
      Parameters:
      projectId - is the id of the project to update.
      Throws:
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is noone signed in.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not the assignee.
      InexistentProjectException - if the Project with projectId does not exist.
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      IllegalProjectStatusChangeException - if the current status of the project is not IN_PROGRESS.

    • turnInProject

      public void turnInProject​(int projectId) throws InexistentProjectException, java.sql.SQLException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, UnauthorisedOperationException, IllegalProjectStatusChangeException
      Sets the projects status tu turned-in provided that the current user is the assignee and the status of the project is not already turned-in or finished.
      Parameters:
      projectId - is the id of the project to turn in.
      Throws:
      InexistentProjectException - if the project with projectId does not exist.
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is noone signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not the assignee.
      IllegalProjectStatusChangeException - if the project's current status is turned-in or finished.

    • undoTurnIn

      public void undoTurnIn​(int projectId, Project.Status newStatus) throws InexistentProjectException, java.sql.SQLException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, UnauthorisedOperationException, IllegalProjectStatusChangeException
      Removes the turn-in and sets the project's status to newStatus, which can be either TO_DO or IN_PROGRESS, provided that the current user is the assignee.
      Parameters:
      projectId - if the id of the project whose status is changed.
      newStatus - is the new status of the project.
      Throws:
      InexistentProjectException - if the project with projectId does not exist.
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is noone signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not the assignee.
      IllegalProjectStatusChangeException - if the current status of the project is not TURNED_IN or the newStatus is not TO_DO or IN_PROGRESS.

    • acceptAsFinished

      public void acceptAsFinished​(int projectId) throws InexistentProjectException, java.sql.SQLException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, UnauthorisedOperationException, IllegalProjectStatusChangeException
      Sets a previously turned in project's status to finished, but only if the current user is the supervisor.
      Parameters:
      projectId - is the id of the finished project.
      Throws:
      InexistentProjectException - if the project with projectId does not exist.
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is noone signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not the supervisor.
      IllegalProjectStatusChangeException - if the project with projectId is not yet turned in.

    • discardTurnIn

      public void discardTurnIn​(int projectId, Project.Status newStatus) throws InexistentProjectException, java.sql.SQLException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, UnauthorisedOperationException, IllegalProjectStatusChangeException
      Changes the status of the project with projectId to newStatus, but unly if the current user is the supervisor.
      Parameters:
      projectId - is the id of the project to update.
      newStatus - is the new status of the project. Cannot be finished.
      Throws:
      InexistentProjectException - if the project does not exist.
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not pe performed in the database.
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is noone signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not the supervisor.
      IllegalProjectStatusChangeException - if the current state is not TURNED_IN, or the newState is FINISHED or TURNED_IN.

    • getProjects

      public java.util.List<Project> getProjects​(boolean assignedToCurrentUser, boolean supervisedByCurrentUser, java.util.EnumSet<Project.Status> allowedStatuses, java.util.EnumSet<Project.DeadlineStatus> allowedDeadlineStatuses, Project.SorterType sorterType, boolean descending) throws NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, java.sql.SQLException
      Returns a list of all the projects in the team with teamId, assigned to a user with assigneeId, if assigeeId is not null, otherwise assigned to any user, supervised by a user with id supervisorId, if supervisorId is not null, otherwise supervised by any user, having any status specified by queryStatus (possibly ALL), and a status with respect to the deadline specified by queryProject.DeadlineStatus.
      Parameters:
      allowedStatuses - is the set of all statuses which are allowed for the returned projects.
      assignedToCurrentUser - shows whether the returned projects should be assigned to the current user (true) or assigned to anyone (false).
      supervisedByCurrentUser - shows whether the returned projects should be supervised by the current user (true) or supervised by anyone (false).
      allowedDeadlineStatuses - is the set of deadline statuses which are allowed for the returned projects.
      Returns:
      the list of projects fulfilling all the above requirements.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operations could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is noone signed in.

    • getProjectsOfTeam

      public java.util.List<Project> getProjectsOfTeam​(int teamId, java.lang.String supervisorName, java.lang.String assigneeName, java.util.EnumSet<Project.Status> allowedStatuses, java.util.EnumSet<Project.DeadlineStatus> allowedDeadlineStatuses, Project.SorterType sorterType, boolean descending) throws InexistentDatabaseEntityException, java.sql.SQLException, InexistentUserException
      Returns a list of all the projects in the team with teamId, assigned to a user with assigneeId, if assigeeId is not null, otherwise assigned to any user, supervised by a user with id supervisorId, if supervisorId is not null, otherwise supervised by any user, having any status specified by queryStatus (possibly ALL), and a status with respect to the deadline specified by queryProject.DeadlineStatus.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team whose projects are returned.
      allowedStatuses - is the set of all statuses which are allowed for the returned projects.
      assigneeName - is an optional parameter. If it is null, it doesn't count. Othwerise, only those projects are returned, which are assigned to the user with name assigneeName.
      supervisorName - is an optional parameter. If it is null, it doesn't count. Othwerise, only those projects are returned, which are supervised by the user with id supervisorName.
      allowedDeadlineStatuses - is the set of deadline statuses which are allowed for the returned projects.
      sorterType - desifes how (if any) the returned projects must be sorted.
      descending - specifies the order of sorting. If true, the projects are sorted in descending order, otherwise ascending. If the sorterType is NONE, this parameter does not count.
      Returns:
      the list of projects fulfilling all the above requirements.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operations could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      InexistentUserException - if the user with assigneeName or supervisorName does not exist in the database.

    • currentUserIsSupervisor

      public boolean currentUserIsSupervisor​(Project project) throws InexistentDatabaseEntityException, NoSignedInUserException
      Parameters:
      project - is the project whose supervisor is checked.
      Returns:
      true iff the current user is the supervisor of project.
      Throws:
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is noone signed in.

    • currentUserIsAssignee

      public boolean currentUserIsAssignee​(Project project) throws InexistentDatabaseEntityException, NoSignedInUserException
      Parameters:
      project - is the project whose assignee is checked.
      Returns:
      true iff the current user is the assignee of project.
      Throws:
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - should never occur.
      NoSignedInUserException - if there is noone signed in.

    • getProjectById

      public Project getProjectById​(int projectId) throws InexistentProjectException, java.sql.SQLException
      Gets the project with the specified id.
      Parameters:
      projectId - uniquely identifies the project
      Returns:
      the project if it was found
      Throws:
      InexistentProjectException - if the project with that id was not found
      java.sql.SQLException - if a database related error occurs

    • guaranteeNoUnfinishedAssignedOrSupervisedProjects

      public void guaranteeNoUnfinishedAssignedOrSupervisedProjects​(java.lang.String member, int teamId) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, InexistentUserException, IllegalMemberRemovalException
      Guarantee that the member of the given team has no unfinished projects assigned to them or supervised by them.
      Parameters:
      member - = the name of the member
      teamId - = id of the team of the given member
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - in case a database error occurs
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - in case there is no team with the given id
      InexistentUserException - if no member exists with given name
      IllegalMemberRemovalException - if the given member has any unfinished projects left
